data.title: Authors and Illustrators
data.text:
Louisa May Alcott

Stimpson, J. "Reading for Love." New Literary History 21.4 (1990): 957-77. Little Women as an example of the value of reading.

See also CRITICS: Vallone

Harry Allard

See CRITICS: Russell

Lloyd Alexander

Tunnell, Michael O. and James S. Jacobs. "Fantasy at Its Best: Alexander's Chronicles of Prydain." Children's Literature in Education 21.4 (Dec. 1990): 229-36. Characteristics that explain the series' continuing popularity. G.A.

Hans Christian Andersen

Conroy, Patricia and Sven H. Rossel, editors and translators. The Diaries of Hans Christian Andersen. Seattle: U of Washington P, 1989. 502 pp. ISBN 0 295 96845 1. $45. Review Jonathan Keates, "The Overstayer," Times Literary Supplement 15 Feb. 1991: 24. Covers his childhood, his travels, his visit to Dickens in 1857, and his old age. G.A.

Holbek, Bengt. "Hans Christian Andersen's Use of Folktales." Merveilles & Contes 4.2 (Dec. 1990): 220-32. The nature of Andersen's adaptations of Danish oral tradition when he rewrote the tales for the children of the bourgeoisie. G.A.

Piehl, Kathy. "Under the Sea-and Above: Picture Books that Link the Human World to Other Realms." CLA Bulletin 17, no. 1 (Spring 1991): 18-22. Examines several picture book versions of "The Little Mermaid" and looks at other stories of transformations of sea creatures, birds, and other beings. L.H.

Smith, Janet. "Hard Times." The New York Review of Books 27 June 1991: 26-31. An essay on Andersen triggered by, but not devoted to, Patricia Conroy's The Diaries of Hans Christian Andersen and Wolfgang Lederer's The Kiss of the Snow Queen (U of California P, 1986). The first part is autobiographical with quotes from the diaries; the second part discusses the trips to England and visit to Dickens; the third part is on Lederer's book. C.L.

Ginette Anfousse

See ILLUSTRATION: Gagnon

Arthurian

Andronick, Catherine M. "More About King Arthur." Book Report 9.4 (Jan.-Feb. 1991): 37-38. Some works of Arthurian literature which might interest high-school readers. G.A

Peter Christen Asbjørnsen

See Jørgen Moe

Frank Asch

Asch, Frank. "Writing Here Comes the Cat." The Dragon Lode 9.1 (Winter 1991): 1-4. On his long-distance collaboration with the Soviet illustrator Vladimir Vagin starting in 1986. Their book came out in 1989, won the Soviet National Book Award, and is now being animated. G.A

Comtesse d'Aulnoy

Trost, Caroline T. "'Belle-Belle ou le chevalier Fortuné': A Liberated Woman in a Tale by Mme d'Aulnoy." Merveilles &Contes 5.1 (May 1991): 57-67. The story of a woman disguised as a man who surpasses her male lover presents an androgynous paradigm unjustly neglected by feminists. G.A.

Natalie Babbitt

Babbitt, Natalie. "The Mad Tea Party Maxim: Or How Books Don't Always Mean What the Writer Intended." Children's Literature in Education (June 1991): 89-96. Keynote address at the Annual Reading and Writing Conference for Teachers, U of North Carolina at Charlotte, October, 1987. While authors mean what they say, they may not always say what they mean; thus readers may understand an author's work better than the author does. G.A.

Allan Baillie

Jameyson, Karen. "News From Down Under." Horn Book 67.4 (July-Aug. 1991): 493-95. Praises Baillie's "vivid physical" settings and his ability to trap and hold readers. L.H.

James Baldwin

See Leonard A. Slade, Jr.

J. M. Barrie

Jack, R. D. S. The Road to the Never Land: A Reassessment of J. M. Barrie's Dramatic Art. Aberdeen: Aberdeen University Press, 1991. ISBN 0 08 037742 4.

Rafferty, Terence. "Fear of Flying." The New Yorker 30 Dec. 1991: 80-83. A detailed discussion of Steven Spielberg's version of Peter Pan, Hook. G.A.

See also FANTASY: Gilead

Giambattista Basile

See FOLK: McGlathery

Caroline Feller Bauer

Gordon, Lucy Latané. "Caroline Feller Bauer The Pied Piper of [End Page 51] Children's Books." Wilson Library Bulletin 65.5 (January 1991): 56-58, 146. A profile/interview with a children's book author and authority on children's books and recreational reading. G.A

Marion Dane Bauer

Bauer, Marion Dane. "An Author's...
